comment.text:
Excellent front staff
Wonderful wait staff
Beautiful decor /ambiance 
The food was excellent-
Fresh and beautiful presentation
Great dtinks
Lovely bar area
Restaurant located in hotel lobby.
Plenty of parking 
Great for large groups 
Great for lovely intimate dinner.
Request white line tables over booth-
Lovelier experience

Fia has the best lamb shank in town... so perfectly cooked. Overall food, ambience are both amazing. Service is also great but one of the servers can be a bit pushy. 
This is a great spot for date night. Their wine and cocktail collection is fantastic. The chocolate mouse cake is the perfect ending to a lovely meal.
First time dining experience and it was excellent. The food and our server were awesome. Great vibe all around.

Always so good!!!

Salmon
Spicy spaghetti 
Goat cheese salad
Octopus 

Everything was delicious as usual!

Fia is a hidden high end gem in Atlanta. They offer a beautiful atmosphere, exemplary service, and a limited, but well executed menu for both the adventurous and reserved palate. 

You certainly would not expect this from a restaurant situated inside a hotel, but Fia delivers exceptional cuisine and outstanding service on the higher end of the price scale. When I'm the main restaurant space it has a quiet peaceful ambiance that pairs well with formal business meetings or intimate date nights.

I want to start this review by saying two things: do not let the fact that this restaurant is inside a hotel deter you AND do not let the plain appearance of the outside of the building hold you back either! Once you enter the hotel, you feel like you are in a completely different establishment than the one you walked into. The inside has some of the coolest décor I've seen, a very large bar and lounge area if you're in the mood for some cocktails and small bites and the dining room has both booths and tables available right next to the open faced kitchen area. The ambiance is on point and the food is even better! I dined here with friends a few weeks ago and everything from the service to the food was superb. My friend and I agreed that we have not had a meal that good at a restaurant in a long time. We ordered a lot of things for our dinner and shared everything except our main entrees. I literally loved everything we ordered, which is rare for me. We learned that Fia means fire in Italian and it was a fitting name, because everything was fire! But really, it is called Fia, because several of their signature dishes are grilled over a wood fire grill. We tried the beets & burrata, pan seared potato gnocchi, pork belly, charred octopus, & grilled ciabatta bread as our starters. If you don't want to order all of these, I would say that the pork belly and the gnocchi are the must trys. Pro tip: be sure to order the grilled ciabatta bread with the gnocchi, because it comes with a yummy sauce that you will want to dip your bread in. For my entrée, I did the 8 ounce center cut filet with a side of crispy brussels sprouts. I highly recommend both of these items as both had that nice wood fire grill char to them, which made them extra flavorful! For the dessert, we did the Bananas Foster. Even though it is not prepared tableside, it tastes amazing. I say all this to say, you need to dine at Fia! It is a restaurant that everyone needs to experience!

Warm ambience around happy people who are not too loud. Started with Mr B's cocktail. It was interestingly refreshing! We decided on small plates or appetizers. They were all sumptuous that we forgot to take pictures prior to devouring them! My husband had the grilled octopus - twice. The shrimp saganaki (sp?) was delicious. I requested for additional toasted bread that came with it. It was so good with the sauce. But I didn't get them even when I said I was willing to pay for it. Maybe because I told another server since ours was tied up with a big group. Oh and the pork belly is to die for! The crispy small potatoes were also delicious and matched the well flavored pork belly sauce. We were not too hungry. We would go back to try the entrees when we're back in Atlanta. PS: the photos attached do not justify the deliciousness of the food we ate!

A stunning restaurant, Fia features a boutique cocktail bar, wood-fire grill, and Mediterranean-inspired dishes.

I had a bit of difficulty locating Fia, mainly because I didn't know it was inside The Burgess Hotel. Once I found it, everything else was smooth sailing. I was pleasantly surprised to find plenty of free parking!

My friend and I made reservations for an early dinner on a Friday evening. The restaurant wasn't quite busy yet when we arrived, but started to fill up as the evening went on. Our server was fantastic. I wish I remembered her name. She was very attentive and helpful. She made great suggestions.

My friend and I ordered the following:
Espresso martinis 
Pan seared potato gnocchi 
Whole branzino
Crispy Brussels sprouts
Fingerling potatoes

We shared everything, except for the martinis -- we each got our own. :) We started with the pan seared potato gnocchi which was our server's recommendation. It came with beurre monte, white truffle, thyme, and parmesan and was incredible. Everything else was excellent; cooked and seasoned to perfection. The branzino is great for sharing especially if you get a couple of sides. We ordered plenty for the two of us. Our sweet server heard we were celebrating so she brought us a delicious and creamy creme brulee. Perfect ending to our night!

Food, service, and ambiance were all on point. Fia is a little pricey, and worth every penny! Great place for date nights and/or other special occasions.

photos.caption: Branzino (split in half), crispy Brussels sprouts, and fingerling potatoes

comment.text: Wifey and I have visited Fia several times. It's time we left a review. Fia is fantastic, every time.  Service, cocktails and food are on point. The chef takes pride in his product and it shows. Wood fired grill puts out some quality dishes and fun to watch the guys work the fire as you can see the kitchen. Overall A+. We'll continue to support Fia.
Pretty good food. Phenomenal service. Highly recommend! The pork belly appetizer was outstanding. The restaurant decor was beautiful.
This restaurant is located in the Burgess hotel. The gnocchi, bread service, watermelon salad, and charred octopus were all amazing. Service is truly 5-star. Would recommend.

Visiting area and decided to try Fia based on online menu review and ratings. I generally shy away from hotel-based restaurants when I dine out, especially fine dining. And, when pulling up and realizing this was part of a small hotel, I almost left 
(did not have reservations). However, I'm glad we stayed. 
The food was amazing. The menu is largely gluten-free without even asking, and the variety of dishes, styles, & unique preparations - even on common dishes like a wedge salad - was incredible. Cocktails and wine were fantastic. 
And the boutique hotel seems pretty snazzy, too. As someone who has traveled extensively over 20 years, and can cook better than most restaurants I eat at, I can't recommend highly enough.

The famous Mark created this gem for me. We named it the Blind Spit! He's the best. Love this bar and restaurant so much. It's such a great vibe but consistently delicious wood. The wood fired branzino is unmatched. Also the octopus app is always a go!

photos.caption: Marks Gin creation... the Blind spot

comment.text: The food was delicious. I really enjoyed the pork belly and fried gnocchi. The spaghetti was a little spicy but still delicious.
The staff was very nice. I had the lamb shank for my 22nd and it was amazing. Apps and sides great too.

Love it here  valet is cool. The food is great and the bartenders are super friendly. I came here one night alone and played the bar. Met a nice gentleman, gentlemen often frequent the bar due to the hotel hosting lots of business men

photos.caption: I ate everything but the head & tail lol it was so good. Whole Branzino

comment.text:
I came across Fia through Yelp reviews, and we decided to try it out. Hidden inside the Burgess Hotel, I can honestly say that Fia has some great food. We tried several things off the menu. 

To start, we had a caprese salad, and the pan seared potato gnocchi (with grilled ciabatta bread). Everything was great. For dinner, we decided on the center cut filet (added the truffle butter) and the whole branzino with crispy Brussel sprouts. Every bite was amazing. All ingredients are locally sourced.

The ambiance of the restaurant was great, plus we were able to get a table in front of the kitchen which was an experience within itself. Plus, John, our server, was great. Very knowledgeable and friendly, plus he helped us with every picture taken.

Amazing experience here 10/10. The food & service was amazing!! I'm desperate to go back for the delicious chicken dish. The gnocchi appetizer is just as tasty, make sure you get the bread to eat with it. Drinks are good & strong. It's inside of a hotel with some self parking available. Although I came when they first opened & it was pretty empty, I would recommned making reservations. It looks like it gets packed quickly.

Great Service, Good Food, Great Ambiance

Celebrated my eldest son's bday. JT, our server, provided excellent service. He made a great dinner as we celebrated his bday. We tried nine of the appetizers and the meat balls and the pork belly were my favorites. The watermelon was refreshing. The gnocchi was a bit vinegary tasting. The charred octopus was fantastic. 

The Moroccan Chicken was tender and flavorful. My son enjoyed the lamb chops. 

We topped this off with crème brûlée and the goat cheese strawberry compote. Yummy!!

The service was a 10. The food was amazing a 10, I ordered the wedge salad, it was a work of art and very tasty. I also ordered the salmon and it was cooked perfectly.  My husband ordered the curry prawns. He loved it. We also ordered a  lemon drop martini and old fashion. Overall this dinner date was top tier. The service was excellent.  I have absolutely no complaints.  Hands down one of the best restaurants in Atlanta.

photos.caption: We forgot to take before pictures.  It was so good.

comment.text: Came to this restaurant for a friends birthday dinner and it did not disappoint. I was a little nervous because it was inside a hotel but it did what it was supposed to do! The story behind the entire hotel is nice the hostess let us know about the Burgess family. The vibe in the restaurant, bar and study area speaks to lounge good times with sophistication. The drinks were crafted well just not consistent the first round tasted a bit different than the second event though we got the same drinks but they were still pretty good. We tried the pork belly, char grilled octopus and Caesar salad for starters. All great! The fresh anchovies were great on the salad and the pork belly was like candied with the grits. The octopus was grilled well without being chewy. We also had the short rib, branzino, scallops and tomato basil soup! All I can say is go and experience.

WARNING -$50 CORKAGE FEE - UNDISCLOSED. Brought 2 bottles of wine. Server (JT) never said fee was $50 and it is nowhere on the menu. The automatic gratuity of 20% for our party of 6 was calculated with the ridiculous corkage fee included. Highest corkage fee of any restaurant we have been to in Atlanta!  When we asked JT and the manager/owner about it, they both were obnoxious and rude with the attitude of "if you don't like it, don't come back."  JT threw our bill down on the table. With so many great restaurant options in Atlanta and Buckhead, I will NEVER go back to Fia or recommend it to anyone. The horrible customer service ruined the entire experience. First and LAST time.
The food is so good that it feels like meditation. Service is just above average. Ambiance is also very unique. I highly recommend it and I would definitely go back.

The reviews are spot-on for this restaurant. The food is amazing. Service is outstanding. Beautiful decor. I love that you can see everything being cooked in the kitchen.
The Burgess Hotel is a beautiful boutique hotel that offers the perfect setting for Fia.
We started with the grilled meatballs. So flavorful and not too heavy,
We both ended up ordering the scallops with the risotto and shared the brussel sprouts. Everything was seasoned perfectly and I loved the presentation with the micro greens that add a nice texture to the meal. Another gem in Atlanta that is a must. 

I have to reiterate that the entire staff at the hotel, bar, and Fia are fantastic. Impeccable service and lots of smiling faces made the night even more enjoyable.

photos.caption: Just a small portion of the cocktail menu at the bar,
The Crispy Brussels Sprouts are so good.
Pan Seared New England Scallops and Crispy Brussels Sprouts. YUMMMMM
Coconut Pecan Old Fashioned. Sooo good.

comment.text:
We went to "Fia" for our anniversary ! It's a hidden gem! 
It's located within Burgess Hotel. Fia came as a recommendation for romantic fine dining ! Hidden gem
- as it appeared not very crowded and easy to get reservation , but the food - it was really special . Fia is about fire - predominantly Mediterranean cuisine , with a fusion twist . We had their Hummus - first hot hummus and it was beyond good - we tried their gnocchi and that too was exemplary . My wife tried vegetarian risotto with wild mushrooms - she loved it . I had Moroccan Chicken with saffron rice - it was a surreal treat . Service was exceptional - staff were well aware of what Fia stands for - am
Just surprised why this place isn't a rave ! Am coming here again!
Parking is complementary - but limited !

The food here is amazing! I'm still thinking about that gnocchi mushroom sauce & that ciabatta... 

Located inside the Burgess Hotel, this cute little restaurant is definitely one of my new favorites in Atlanta. 

Having gone with a group, we were able to order various items and they were all great, some outstanding than others. 

Appetizers:
- Pan seared potato gnocchi
- Grilled ciabatta
- Charred octopus
- Caprese salad

My entree:
- Bone-in short rib

Sides:
- Crispy brussels sprouts
- Grilled broccolini 

Dessert:
- Goat cheese & local honey panna cotta
- Bananas foster
- Vanilla creme brulee
- Key lime tart 

It's hard to pick as everything was really delicious, full of flavor. But my favorites would have to be the gnocchi (that sauce!), ciabatta (def recommend dipping in the gnocchi sauce), and brussels sprouts. Oh, can't forget the short rib - it was a thing of beauty. Believe they said it was cooked over 72 hours? Or something like that, and the meat was so. tender. Service was great, as well.

For the drinks, started off with the Gin Gin Gimlet, had some Pinot noir, but had to go back to the gimlet, it was just the right amount of tartness & sweetness. 

Can't wait to go back and try other dishes!

photos.caption: Charred Octopus, Grilled Ciabatta, Pan Seared Potato Gnocchi, Caprese Salad

comment.text: Best kept secret! It's fabulous! Love, love the atmosphere. Food is outstanding. Love the bar. Love the he sofa's by the fireplace.

I love this place. The food is consistently delicious and the cocktails are tasty. I have had the Grilled Whole Branzino,  Spicy Pork Sausage Spaghetti, Broccolini, and Grilled Meatballs to eat and the Coconut Pecan Old Fashioned and Cosmopolitan to drink. That spaghetti dish was everything! It was savory with the right amount of spicy and the Coconut Pecan Old Fashioned was a nice twist on a classic cocktail. For dessert, I had the Goat Cheese & Local Honey Panna Cotta which was light, not too sweet, and the perfect ending to my meal.

     The service was also outstanding! Shout out to Brianna our server who was extremely attentive, Ashley the bartender who was crafting the delicious cocktails, and Nieshta the manager who was making her rounds and checking in with patrons to ensure customer satisfaction. Great job ladies, can't wait to see you all again!

photos.caption: Goat Cheese & Local Honey Panna Cotta.

comment.text:
We so appreciated the welcoming atmosphere and flavorful food at Fia. We enjoyed late night appetizers--octopus, wedge salad, and pork belly and cocktails (a coconut and pecan old fashioned and a spicy mezcal and lime cocktail) so much we cancelled a reservation we had elsewhere and returned for a full dinner the next day.

Our table started with the Cesar salad, pan seared potato gnocchi with a brown butter truffle/mushroom sauce and the asparagus with ham and egg. Two of us enjoyed 8oz Center Cut Filets with chimichurri and truffle butter, which were well seasoned and cooked to perfection (med rare). Another in our party enjoyed the bone-in short rib, which was wonderful. 

The staff was so welcoming and hospitable; the GM and chef/owner were genuinely interested in delighting their guests. We will definitely return for another visit!

I love this place.  Not only is it beautiful, the food is incredible.  The wait staff is so well versed in their menu.  The chef gets the portions and delights correct every time.   Thanks for being the charm of my community! 
Keith

This was a welcome surprise. It's a rare thing where the rave reviews are true but this restaurant deserves every single compliment given to it. I was perturbed upon arrival as I was unaware the restaurant is located inside a hotel lobby but nothing can deter me after the first taste of my amazing cocktail which I'm convinced that the coconut pecan old fashioned is the best cocktail in the city. Both our appetizer were delicious which were the tomato tartlet & gnocci. The salmon was good as well but not as delicious as the appetizers. To my dismay the Japanese wagyu had been substituted for Australian beef however I was still impressed & I can't wait to return

photos.caption: Bread to soak up the garlic & truffle from the gnocchi dish
Extra pea cans in my probably my third drink. Trust me it's that good
"Coconut Pecan Old Fashioned" the very best cocktail in all of Atlanta.

comment.text: This was a five star dining experience. We came tonight for our anniversary and we were so thankful this was where we selected. Our waiter John was by far the best waiter in his recommendations and service. He was attentive, everything he recommended was delicious. The Japanese Wagyu Ribeye is probably one of the best steaks in town, if not the best. The drinks, appetizers and Brussels were the icing on the cake. We are already planning our next visit and we think the ambiance and setting is perfect for a date night or a place to bring people visiting from out of town. We will definitely be back !

This was our pre-Valentine's dinner with friends and it was amazing. I've been to Fia before and enjoyed it each time, but after last night, I felt it was time to show my appreciation. It's definitely going to be on our short list of repeat restaurants.

The food is amazing. I don't want to go into the minutia of each dish but we ordered just about every appetizer and wish we had ordered the missing ones. You cannot go wrong. The decor transports you to exotic lands and despite being all this, you still feel like you are at a family owned intimate eatery where everyone really cares. It's obvious the staff has a lot of pride in what they do and the restaurant they work at. Are you one of those people like me who wonders "what has happened to customer service"? Well, Fia remembers. Everyone was terrific but Yannick (The GM) and Chef Burgess were absolute standouts. I couldn't believe it when Chef Burgess brought out certain dishes to our table  himself! When was the last time a chef did that?

I've been to all the best restaurants of Atlanta and imho Fia is the best of the best!

PS: even if you don't think you want the bananas foster, get the bananas foster. It's to die for

We are passing through Atlanta and decided to stay at the newly minted Marriott acquisition - The Burgess Hotel. After a day of driving we weren't interested in getting back into the car to go "out" for dinner. We grabbed a bar table at Fia in the lobby area. 
The restaurant was very busy. This is always a promising sign, but can also lead to less stellar experiences with service: TBD... I saw many parties come and go fro the restaurant through the 2 hour meal time we had. The vast majority arrived and left by car. The locals were here to try Fia and weren't even staying on property! This has to be good.
The food was very good. Octopus appetizer, charred ciabatta, outstanding wedge with blue cheese mousse, and perfect house made spaghetti noodles in an - out of this world - creamy Italian sausage marinara. Every dish met and exceeded expectations for flavor and originality.
The service was good from our waiter who was covering all of the tables in the bar area with a little help from the hostess. That being said, the busyness of the scene did translate to a slightly disorganized experience. Come for the food, just make reservations and be sure to sit in the dining room.

FOOD: 
90% of what we had was phenomenal, the remaining 10% was just okay
-Porkbelly: 10/10
-Wedge salad: 2/10 
-Center cut filet w chimichurri: 10/10
-Fingerling potatoes:10/10
-Brussels sprouts: 6/10 (very over-sauced)
-Everything was so FLAVORFUL - great use of spices and herbs
One of my biggest annoyances with dining out is a lot of the time, food comes out not hot enough - that was NOT the case here, and it made all the difference. THANK YOU, FIA!

SERVICE:
We were seated at a table by the bar, and our waiter was also the bartender. LV took great care of us, but I think our experience would have been better if we had been seated in the main part of the restaurant just due to some of the bar patrons were pretty loud.

AMBIENCE:
Fia is in the lobby of The Burgess Hotel, and since we were seated by the bar, it definitely felt like we were dining in the lobby of a hotel. The main section of the restaurant looks much more inviting and is more tucked away from the main lobby of the hotel.

OVERALL:
We had a great time with some great food. Next time we'll ask to sit in the main part of the restaurant.

Incredible creative menu!! The chef is the owner of Fia and the hotel. His wife and family all work there. Very hands on!  It was almost like they were serving you from their home. Also had the Braised Lamb shank but dove into it too quick

Would give 5 stars, but couldn't just because of service. It wasn't bad, just ok. To start, our food and drinks were very good. Steak was overpriced in my opinion, but my boyfriend chose to get it, so that's on him haha. 
The main thing that bothered me was that one of our sides came out late. We received an apology, but to me it seemed half-hearted honestly. When you pay over $200 to eat somewhere, you should have top notch service in my opinion. I understand that the food industry is difficult to work in, but I do expect that if food item is late, it should be taken off of the bill. 
So all in all, a good experience. Just an annoying mishap, and I do wish our waiter was more personable.

Came here to treat my parents for Mother's Day! We all loved it. Fresh, quality food for elevated american cuisine! Lots of spices, flavorful, unique and just overall YUMMMM!!! 10/10 would recommend and come back again!

Great atmosphere, beautiful modern decor with an open view of the kitchen! Generous wine pours, good flavorful food that isn't too greasy or heavy! I am left feeling full and satisfied but not weighed down.

photos.caption: Banana's foster with vanilla ice cream, 10/10

comment.text:
A great experience.  The food was excellent from the appetizers:  goat cheese tartelettes, giant prawns to the main dishes:  salmon dish and scallops with risotto.  I really recommend the scallops by the way.  Also the side dish of Brussels sprouts with balsamic reduction is a must.

The service was impeccable, attentive and friendly.

I will be back

In Atlanta for business. Called up an old friend to meet for dinner. He booked a reservation at Fia. 

What a gem. Don't be thrown off by the fact that this restaurant is in the lobby of a hotel; this is fine dining at its best. 

Started with the wedge salad, which was absolutely perfect.  The blue cheese dressing was exceptional. 

Main course was the bone-in short rib, which my buddy described as "a Fred Flintstone sized piece of meat. It was perfectly seasoned, and perfectly cooked (medium rare). The jasmine rice was a perfect compliment to the beef. We also had the spicy stewed garbanzo beans, which were equally amazing. 

Everything about Fia is top notch: the service, the environment, and most importantly the food were off the charts. The most pleasant surprise was the prices: Fia is a steal price wise for the product delivered. 

If you find yourself in the area, make sure to check out this gem.
The Branzino is A1! I've had larger portions elsewhere, but it's still the best I've had in Atlanta.

user.name: Teresa K.
user.address: San Juan Antiguo, San Juan, Puerto Rico

comment.text:
Let's start with the food was absolutely amazing! Everyone enjoyed everything from the cocktails to the appetizers and the main course. Special Thanks to Yannick for graciously accommodating our larger group and and our two amazing hosts/servers (especially Abby) 
My Husband's Birthday dinner was a huge success!

Selected this restaurant to celebrate my parents anniversary. Excellent choice. Service was awesome. Food was hot, excellent flavor and perfect portions. Ambiance was perfect. Would absolutely recommend and will be back!

Everything was amazing. 

Came for a birthday dinner.  We're made a reservation but unfortunately the host told us people were staying longer than typical and our table wasn't ready.  We understand,  people have been locked down (or reducing how much they go out the last year). We'replanning to go to the bar after dinner anyway so it was a win win.  

We sat at the sexy bar and ordered a drink. The bartender was pleasant,  attentive, and managed drink orders well. The bar was beautifully stocked and the bar area was picturesque. The host kept us abreast of our table being available.  I heard maybe the apologies for the delay.  The bar wins four new because my personal test of a good bar is thre ability to make a good basil gin gimlet.  The drink itself is very simple but only stocked bars/ kitchens have fresh basil on hand. The bartender perfectly muddled and strained my cocktail to have a slight essence of basil.

The dining room is dimly lit and somewhat mysterious. It's not a large dining room but it also felt full. There is a view of the kitchen where the staff is cooking up a storm like a delicate dance. 

Our server refreshed our cocktails and got started with recommendations. The server went through the menu as if it was a tasting menu, carefully describing the dishes, cooking style, and flavor profiles.  My group settled on the following:

Braised Lamb Shank
Chicken Tangine
Crispy Brussels 
Grilled Meatballs
Bar fries
Grilled brocolini
Whole Grilled Branzino

The grilled meatballs elicited a happy food jig in my seat. The fresh herbs, tender meatballs, and a green sauce... gaaaah. Delicious. I had a smattering of things because I wanted to try several sides and couldn't commit to an entree. Also, these might be the best fries in Atlanta. So some but the salt/chili dust was perfect. 

The tagine chicken was served tableside in a dramatic tandoori  pot that is "unveiled" on the table. It was perfectly tender and delicate blend of savory, olives, Tangine flavorings. The almond rice was a nice touch too. 

The braised lamb shank was larger than a baby arm. I actually believe there were two shanks on the plate. The lamb wasnt gamey and super tender.

I didnt personally try the branzino but Jr was described as mild, flakey white fish with hardly any bones. 

The only thing that keeps this from a 5 star experience is how long it rob to get the bill.  We were sitting maybe 10ft from the server station but we couldn't get our servers attention for maybe 15mins AFTER we were done our meal. No wonder the previous guest ran over our reservation. 

I would absolutely go back and suggest it to others.  There is no formal dress code but every one from the guest,  chef,  server,  host,  and bartender looked nice. This is a great anniversary dinner, date night vibe.

Food and drinks delicious. I was unsure if this would be an enjoyable experience, as this restaurant is inside a hotel. I was pleasantly surprised!  I ordered the scallops and my date ordered the leg of lamb. Both dishes were chef kiss delicious! The bar is outstanding. Great place for a date or a group. I forgot my server's name, but she was outstanding!

This restaurant doesn't stand out from the street, but it's a good find. It's on the ground floor of a small hotel. 

Reservations were simple, staff was very helpful. It's a very pretty restaurant, with various seating options in the social/bar area. Our food was delicious, cooked well. The filet was great quality. Main dishes don't come with sides, you need to order those separately. The spicy spaghetti was homemade and also great. Grilled focaccia was YUM. 

Tables were not too crowded. You can self-park to the side & back of the building. 

The only "con" is that it's pretty pricey - you can't eat here on a budget at all. But otherwise, I'd definitely go back!
Food is phenomenal, the service is great and I LOVE the coziness and the decor of the restaurant/hotel.

One of best in Atlanta

Great rooms, warm bar, excellent food and service. Highly recommend

I've been here a few times now and absolutely enjoyed each visit.
It's a very cozy and chic spot with quite the history.

They have a nice drink menu and there's something for everyone, food wise.
On my last visit I tried octopus app and scallops entree and both were delicious. I also tried Old Ivy drink and it didn't disappoint.

Overall: valet or self parking, patio, full bar, great food and atmosphere.

photos.caption: Scallops with saffron basmati rice with almonds and raisins
Pappardelle pasta with fennel sausage and vodka sauce

comment.text:
Amazing amazing amazing!!!! I won't get on here and write a long post but just know that everything we ordered, and we ordered A LOT, was GREAT! 

-Ribeye with truffle butter( extra $5 for truffle butter)...amazing! 
-Spaghetti...fresh homemade noodles. Had a spicy after taste but not overpowering. Amazing 
-Branazino- whole fish, you can order with the head and tail on or off. Fresh and tasty. 
-Scallops were fresh and tasty
-Pork belly... the best I ever had. Grits were creamy and the sauce gave it a sweet yet savory taste. 
-Brussels sprouts-cooked to perfection. Had a slight sweet taste to balance out the savory. So good! Cooked to perfection. My fav so far. 
-Potato's-large enough to share, tasty dish
-Broccolini-seasoned well and tasty 
-octopus...fresh and tender. Well seasoned 
-Ciabatta- fresh and toasted to perfection. 

Only thing we didn't care for was the hummus. Beautifully displayed and the bread/crackers were good but the hummus itself was not a hit compared to the other items. We sent it back for another order of Brussels sprouts. 

Our server was very knowledgeable and answered all of our questions. I can't remember her name (maybe Danielle) but she was amazing as well as the young lady that checked us in. 

Cute restaurant with cute outside seating. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: USDA Prime Ribeye Steak with truffle butter
